Package gui.TempFiles

Class FlowchartToPng

  • java.lang.Object
    • gui.TempFiles.FlowchartToPng
  • public class FlowchartToPng
extends java.lang.Object
    This class combines flowchart slices (png images) to be converted into a single large image. This is a flowchart to png class. It will make multiple render calls and save the image buffer into smaller images then piece them altogether into a single png image. NOTE: A images (width * height * 4) < Integer.MAX_VALUE if this class is provided width and height greater than that it will crash the application because that is the limit to how much byte buffer can be stored at once. It is best if the (width * height * 4) < sqrt(Integer.MAX_Value), to be safe. NOTE2: On how it works, The idea is that this class creates a sub directory in the temp folder location. You have .col and .row. The algorithm takes the pixel width and height of a flowchart and takes the openGL coordinates of the flowchart. Then it calculates the number of openGL full screen calls at a ratio of the pixel width and height. Each of which a "screenshot" or png is saved into the .col folder. Since the number of columns in the x direction is known this is used to build .rows. From the rows we get the final image. And the final image has a header with a message placed on the top of it. Parser defines the image size, header provides the height and width, and settings menu, defines the header color and text.

      This value in openGL coordinates will move a screen down by one screen width y|(0,1) (-1,0) ---- |---- x (1,0) | (0,-1) So to move down one screen size you translate by 2
      private float MOVE_ONE_SCREEN_RIGHT
      This value in openGL coordinates will move a screen down by one screen width y|(0,1) (-1,0) ---- |---- x (1,0) | (0,-1) So to move down one screen size you translate by 2

      • MOVE_ONE_SCREEN_DOWN

        private final float MOVE_ONE_SCREEN_DOWN
          This value in openGL coordinates will move a screen down by one screen width
                         y|(0,1)
              (-1,0) ---- |---- x (1,0)
                          | (0,-1)
  So to move down one screen size you translate by 2

    • Method Detail

      • startImageSlice

        public void startImageSlice​(int width,
                            int height,
                            ApplicationController controller,
                            java.lang.String outPath)
        Starts slicing the flowchart into chunks then saves each chunk. Then combines all the chunks into a single image. NOTE: If (width * height * 4) > Integer.Max_Value the application will crash!!!
        Parameters:
        width - the pixel height of the image
        height - the pixel width of the image
        controller - this should only be the flowchart controller
        outPath - the path the .png is to be saved to

      • getHeaderRatioSize

        private int getHeaderRatioSize​(int height)
        This takes a height in pixels and returns approximately 10% of it positionally to be used as the height of the header.
        Parameters:
        height - should be the height of the column used for rendering screen shots i.e. heightPixelsChop

      • outFilePathClean

        private java.lang.String outFilePathClean​(java.lang.String sourceOutPath)
        This checks whether a source file contains a .png, if it does not it adds a .png to the end of it. Otherwise it does not do anything.

      • doRenderCall

        private void doRenderCall​(int widthSource,
                          int heightSource,
                          ApplicationController controller,
                          java.lang.String pathOut)
        Does a LWJGL render call for the flowchart. Then saves the image.
        Parameters:
        widthSource - the source width used to render the render window and save image
        heightSource - the height used to render the window and save image
        pathOut - the outPath the image is to be saved to. This should always be set to the .col folder

        private void writePng​(java.lang.String path,
                      int widthSource,
                      int height,
                      int bpp,

        Writes the buffer into a .png image NOTE: If (width * height * 4) > Integer.MAX_Value the program will crash!
        Parameters:
        path - the path the image is saved to
        widthSource - the width of the image to save
        height - the height of the image to save
        buffer - the buffer to copy from

      • combinedPng

        private void combinedPng​(java.lang.String outputPath,
                         float imageSizeX)
        This opens the .img folder and combined columns into rows then rows into a final out image with no header, then adds the header and finally saves that image to the out path.
        Parameters:
        outputPath - the final path the final image is to be saved to
        imageSizeX - the openGL X size of the image

      • doTilingColumnManager

        private static void doTilingColumnManager​(java.lang.String[] source,
                                          int indexSize,
                                          java.lang.String outPath)
        tile column manager. Feeds in images based on a column index. 
             Example: {"file1", "file2", "file3", "file4"}, index = 2
    -> 0:{"file1", "file2"} 1:{"file3", "file4"}
    -> call doTilingColumn

      • doTilingRow

        private void doTilingRow​(java.lang.String[] source,
                         java.lang.String out)
        Do tiling row combines rows of images into a single image. The sizes of the rows MUST have equal heights and widths. IMAGES ONLY WORK WITH PNG FILES!
        Parameters:
        source - list of source files to be combined in a single image from first (top) to last (bottom)
        out - the out file path

      • doTilingColumn

        private static void doTilingColumn​(java.lang.String[] source,
                                   java.lang.String out)
        Do tiling column combines columns of images into a single image. The sizes of the heights MUST be equal. IMAGES ONLY WORK WITH PNG FILES
        Parameters:
        source - list of source files to be combined in a single image from left to right
        out - the out file path

      • getNumberOfImageColumns

        private int getNumberOfImageColumns​(float imageSizeX)
        This approximates the number of image columns it takes to capture the full images width. This is done by subtracting the imageSizeX by the move_right_amount and the int it returns is the number of images needed to represent a full row.
        Parameters:
        imageSizeX - the float that is the openGL X size
        Returns:
        the int value of the number of columns

      • getNumberOfImageColumnsY

        private int getNumberOfImageColumnsY​(float imageSizY)
        This approximates the number of image columns it takes to capture the full images height. This is done by subtracting the imageSizeY by the move_one_screen_down and the int it returns is the number of images needed to represent a full row.
        Parameters:
        imageSizY - the float that is the openGL X size
        Returns:
        the int value of the number of columns

      • writeHeaderPng

        private void writeHeaderPng​(int width,
                            int height,
                            java.lang.String message,
                            java.awt.Font font,
                            java.awt.Color textColor,
                            java.awt.Color backgroundColor,
                            java.lang.String outPath)
        Creates a header message image by a width and height. Then saves it as a png file. The text is centered in the image. NOTE: If (width * height * 4 > Integer.MAX_VALUE) this will crash
        Parameters:
        width - the width of the image. NOTE: Best to use (widthSource*getNumberOfImageColumns(GeneralSettings.IMAGE_SIZE.x)
        height - the height of the image
        message - the message of to be written
        font - the font type and size e.g, new Font("TimesRoman", Font.BOLD, 40)
        textColor - the text color
        backgroundColor - the background color
        outPath - the path the file is saved to. File is always saved as header.png

      • scaleFontToFit

        public static java.awt.Font scaleFontToFit​(java.lang.String text,
                                           int width,
                                           java.awt.Graphics g,
                                           java.awt.Font pFont)
        Scales the font to the max size it can be relative to the width and the width of the characters in the string.
        Parameters:
        text - the text of the string
        width - the width
        g - graphics context
        pFont - previous front
